page.title: 11Industry in Colwick.
page.content: Industry and employment in the area is mainly confined to Colwick Vale and{ {Colwick Industrial Estate.}In the past the railway marshalling yards in Netherfield employed over 1000 people and Britannia Cotton Mills 600 people. Both are now closed. The Industrial Estate caters for{light industry}and a great area is taken up for storage of{ {timber and petrol.}British Petroleum has 55 oil and petrol storage tanks and its own railway terminal. Other larger industries include{furniture {making, printing, textiles and heavy {construction.}Most of the other indus- trial units are taken up by{family {businesses}ranging from light engin- eering to making roller blinds. Two large factories now stand idle, a canning factory for petfood and a sugar beet factory. About{1500 people} work on the Industrial Estate.
